title: Effect of DNA Damage on Cell Cycle

content.description: TABLE 1. DISTRIBUTION OF CONTROL AND EXPERIMENTAL CELLS IN DIFFERENT STAGES OF THE CELL CYCLE AFTER <math alttext="24" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>24</mn></math> HOURS
content.question: <math alttext="G 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>G</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>S</mtext></math> <math alttext="G 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>G</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M</mtext></math> Control <math alttext="96" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>96</mn></math> <math alttext="59" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>59</mn></math> <math alttext="48" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>48</mn></math> <math alttext="81" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>81</mn></math> Experimental <math alttext="142" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>142</mn></math> <math alttext="142" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>142</mn></math> <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn></math> <math alttext="0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0</mn></math> Researchers claimed that cells treated with radiation are unable to progress through the cell cycle. They tested their claim by exposing a group of cells to radiation (experimental group). A group of unexposed cells served as the control group. After <math alttext="24" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>24</mn></math> hours, they determined the number of cells in each stage of the cell cycle and confirmed that all differences were statistically significant. Based on Table 1, which of the following best supports the researchersâ€™ claim?

choices.label: In the experimental group, no cells were able to enter <math alttext="G 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>G</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.

In the control group, the number of cells in <math alttext="G 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>G</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math> was less than the number of cells in <math alttext="M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>M</mtext></math>.
In the control group, the number of cells in each stage decreased as the cell cycle continued.

In the experimental group, the number of cells in <math alttext="G 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>G</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> was the same as the number of cells in <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>S</mtext></math>.

content.answer: In the experimental group, no cells were able to enter <math alttext="G 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>G</mtext><mn>2</mn></msub></math>.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
